suncertify.db

Class DBFileAccess

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.db.DBFileAccess

  • public class DBFileAccess
extends java.lang.Object
    DBFileAccess is responsible for reading and writing records to the database file. It is instantiated and should only be used by the Data class. All records are read and converted to Subcontractor objects and then returned to the Data class to be loaded into cache at startup. This class is also responsible for writing subcontractor objects to disk. This is done in a bulk update by seeking to the file offset of the first record and overwriting all contents with those from cache. This class uses a RandomAccessFile to seek to specific record locations in the database file.
    Author:
    Kieran O'Brien

    • Constructor Detail

      • DBFileAccess

        public DBFileAccess()

    • Method Detail

      • initializeConnection

        public static void initializeConnection(java.lang.String databasePath)
                                 throws DatabaseException
        This method is called by the constructor of Data passing it the absolute file path to the database. It creates a connection to the database file and holds a reference to it for all other static methods in this class to use. This is done only once and every subsequent call is ignored.
        Parameters:
        databasePath - The full absolute file path to the database file
        Throws:
        DatabaseException

      • getAllSubcontractors

        public static java.util.List<SubcontractorRecord> getAllSubcontractors()
                                                                throws DatabaseException
        Starting at record zero, iterates over each data record and converts it to a SubcontractorRecord object until the end of file is reached. Returns the list of subcontractor records as SubcontractorRecord objects. If the subcontractor record is not valid then a null value will be returned and will not be added to the list.
        Returns:
        The list of subcontractor objects
        Throws:
        DatabaseException

      • writeAllSubcontractorsToFile

        public static void writeAllSubcontractorsToFile()
                                         throws DatabaseException
        Saves the contents of the cache back to disk. This method should be called when the application terminates, either normally or abnormally Starting at record zero, writes all subcontractor objects back to the database file overwriting the existing records on disk.
        Throws:
        DatabaseException
